doc.after: 20th century transitions to liberal democracy have come in successive waves of democracy variously resulting from wars revolutions decolonisation and religious and economic circumstances World War I and the dissolution of the Ottoman and Austro Hungarian empires resulted in the creation of new nation states from Europe most of them at least nominally democratic
